comments.body: How about we use `latest.txt` from `https://console.cloud.google.com/storage/kubernetes-release/release` which gets updated automatically during release?

In the future, the values in the docs are going to be munged in some way.
But in this script, I don't know. `curl -sSL https://console.cloud.google.com/storage/kubernetes-release/release/latest.txt` returns a login form, so can't be used right now

This is just an update so `docker-multinode` works, since #17213 is merged.

BTW, do you know why `https://console.cloud.google.com/storage/kubernetes-release/release/latest.txt` requires authentication?
It would be a great way of getting the default in the future
Good question. I checked that `curl -sSL https://storage.googleapis.com/kubernetes-release/release/latest.txt` works as expected. I'll to find out why `console` link requires authentication.

export K8S_VERSION=<your_k8s_version (e.g. 1.2.0-alpha.7)>
export ETCD_VERSION=<your_etcd_version (e.g. 2.2.1)>
export FLANNEL_VERSION=<your_flannel_version (e.g. 0.5.5)>

comments.body: I think it might be helpful to add a note about the setup and pattern here: The following guide will make use of two docker daemons, a pattern which will allow us to manage and deploy "system" services such as flannel and etcd in containers...
At the end of this guide you will have a setup that supports adding additional worker nodes after the initial bootstrapping process.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +10,14 @@  * [Installing a worker node](#adding-a-worker-node)
  * [Testing your cluster](#testing-your-cluster)

## Overview
This guide will set up a 2-node kubernetes cluster, consisting of a _master_ node which hosts the API server and orchestrates work
